APISafeRequest.description: A summary of a SAFE request.

APISafeRequestInvestor.description: Details about the investor buying the equity.

APISafeRequestOrganization.description: Details about the organization selling the equity

AccountStatementPayload.description: Account statement payload with type discriminator

AccountsPaginatedResponse.description:
Paginated response containing a list of accounts.
 | Use the page cursor information to fetch additional pages of accounts.

accounts.description: List of accounts in the current page

page.description: Pagination information including cursors for navigating to next/previous pages

checkInfo.description: Information needed to send a physical check.

contactEmail.description: Contact email address of the recipient

domesticWireRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send a domestic wire.

electronicRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send an ACH.

ApiEventResponse.description:
Represents a single event in the Mercury API event stream.
 | Events track changes to resources over time, providing an audit trail
 | of all modifications with before/after values and metadata about what changed.

changedPaths.description: List of JSON paths that were modified in this event

mergePatch.description: JSON object containing the fields that were changed and their new values

operationType.description: The type of operation performed (e.g., create, update, delete)

previousValues.description: JSON object containing the fields that were changed and their previous values before the update

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource that was affected

resourceType.description: The type of resource that was affected (e.g., transaction, account)

resourceVersion.description: Version number of the resource after this change

ApiEventsPaginatedResponse.description:
Paginated response containing a list of API events.
 | Use the page cursor information to fetch additional pages of events.

events.description: List of events in the current page

page.description: Pagination information including cursors for navigating to next/previous pages

ApiUpdateTransactionRequest.description: Request body for updating transaction metadata via the public API

categoryId.description: How to update the transaction's category. Omit field to keep current, send null to clear, send ID to set.

note.description: How to update the transaction's note. Omit field to keep current, send null/empty to clear, send text to set.

ApiV1ArAttachmentResponseData.description:
The object representing a file attachment for an invoice.
 The file is not a part of this object itself but information
 for where to download it will be in this object.

id.description: The ID of the attachment object.

url.description: The signed download URL for the file itself.

ApiV1ArAttachmentsResponseData.description: The response type for fetching attachments related to an AR Invoice.

ApiV1ArCustomerAddress.description: Customer address information for Accounts Receivable API

ApiV1ArCustomerAddressInput.description: Address input for creating or updating customers

name.description: The mailing name of the address.

region.description: Either a two-letter US state code i.e. "CA" for California or a free-form identification of a particular region worldwide.

ApiV1ArCustomerCreateRequest.description: Request data to create a customer using the public api

email.description: The email address for the customer.

ApiV1ArCustomerResponseData.description: Response data for Accounts Receivable customer API endpoints

deletedAt.description: The time the customer was deleted, if it was deleted.

ApiV1ArCustomerUpdateRequest.description: Request data to update a customer using the public api

email.description: The email address for the customer.

resendOpenInvoices.description:
Open invoices for the customer will be resent with updated data
 when this is true.

ApiV1ArCustomersResponseData.description: Response data for Accounts Receivable customers API endpoint

ApiV1ArInvoiceCreateRequest.description: The request body to create an invoice.

achDebitEnabled.description: Whether or not the invoice can be paid via ACH debit.

ccEmails.description: Emails to be CCed on invoice notifications/reminders.

creditCardEnabled.description: Whether or not the invoice can be paid via credit card. Requires Stripe to be setup for the Mercury account.

customerId.description: Id of the customer the invoice was sent to.

destinationAccountId.description: The ID of the destination account where money will be paid to for this invoice.

dueDate.description: The due date the invoice should be paid by. YYYY-MM-DD

internalNote.description: Internal note for the invoice, visible by users in the organization but not visible to payers.

invoiceDate.description: The date of the invoice, set by the invoice creator and likely to be context specific to the type of transaction. For example, it could be a date a service was performed. YYYY-MM-DD

lineItems.description: The line items for the invoice

payerMemo.description: Memo for the payer of the invoice.

poNumber.description: Purchase order number for the invoice, if applicable.

sendEmailOption.description: Rules for emailing the new invoice to payers. Can be "DontSend" to skip sending or "SendNow" to send immediately. If omitted, defaults to sending immediately.

useRealAccountNumber.description: Whether or not the invoice payment instructions will show the real account and routing number for the destination account or use virtual account numbers instead. Virtual accounts are safer and are preferred in most cases.

ApiV1ArInvoiceResponse.description: The response type for an invoice in the api.

achDebitEnabled.description: Whether or not the invoice can be paid via ach debit.

amount.description: The total amount of the invoice line items plus taxes.

canceledAt.description: The time when the invoice was canceled.

ccEmails.description: Emails to be CCed on invoice notifications/reminders.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the invoice was created.

creditCardEnabled.description:
Whether or not the invoice can be paid via credit card. Requires stripe to be
 setup for the Mercury account.

customerId.description: Id of the customer the invoice was sent to.

destinationAccountId.description: The ID of the destination account where money will be paid to for this invoice.

dueDate.description: The due date the invoice should be paid by.

internalNote.description:
Internal note for the invoice, visible by users in the
 mercury organization but not visible to payers.

invoiceDate.description:
The date of the invoice, set by the invoice creator
 and likely to be context specific to the type of transaction.
 i.e. it could be a date a service was performed, it does not need
 to be the date the invoice was created.

lineItems.description: The line items for the invoice.

payerMemo.description: Memo for the payer of the invoice.

poNumber.description: Purchase order number for the invoice if applicable.

slug.description:
Public slug for an invoice. Used to construct the pay page URL
 as well as the URL to retrieve the PDF of the invoice.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the invoice was updated.

useRealAccountNumber.description:
Whether or not the invoice payment instructions will show the real
 account and routing number for the destination account or use
 virtual account numbers instead.

ApiV1ArInvoiceUpdateRequest.description: The request body to update an invoice.

achDebitEnabled.description: Whether or not the invoice can be paid via ACH debit.

ccEmails.description: List of emails to be CCed on notifications/reminders.

creditCardEnabled.description: Whether or not the invoice can be paid via credit card. Requires Stripe to be setup for the Mercury account.

dueDate.description: The date the invoice should be paid by. YYYY-MM-DD

internalNote.description: Internal note for the invoice, visible by users in the organization but not visible to payers.

invoiceDate.description: The date of the invoice, set by the invoice creator. Does not have to be the day the invoice was created. It can be business specific i.e. service/sale date. YYYY-MM-DD

lineItems.description: The line items for the invoice

payerMemo.description: Memo for the payer of the invoice.

poNumber.description: The purchase order number for the invoice if applicable.

useRealAccountNumber.description: Whether or not the invoice payment instructions will show the real account and routing number for the destination account or use virtual account numbers instead.

creditCardEnabled.description:
Whether or not the invoice can be paid via credit card. Requires stripe to be
 setup for the Mercury account.

Internal note for the invoice, visible by users in the
 mercury organization but not visible to payers.

The date of the invoice, set by the invoice creator
 and likely to be context specific to the type of transaction.

payerMemo.description: Memo for the payer of the invoice.

slug.description: A unique identifier used to build public URLs for this invoice. Use it to construct the payment page URL (https://app.mercury.com/pay/{slug}) or fetch the invoice PDF via /api/v1/ar/invoices/{slug}/pdf.

ApiV1ArLineItemData.description: Data for an invoice line item

name.description: the name of the line item

salesTaxRate.description: the sales tax applied to this item

unitPrice.description: the price of one unit of the item before sales tax

eventTypes.description: Optional array of event types this webhook is subscribed to. Nothing means all events.

filterPaths.description: Optional array of resource field paths to filter events by. Nothing means no filtering.

id.description: Unique identifier for the webhook endpoint

secret.description: Webhook signing secret. Only returned on creation (POST), not on GET or UPDATE operations.

status.description: Current status of the webhook (active, paused, or disabled)

updatedAt.description: When the webhook was last updated

url.description: The URL that will receive webhook POST requests

accountingBasis.description: The accounting basis (cash or accrual) for this template

agentId.description: The agent organization that owns this template

id.description: Unique identifier for the COA template

name.description: Name of the Chart of Accounts template

accountingBasis.description: The accounting basis of the template

Paginated response containing a list of categories.
 | Use the page cursor information to fetch additional pages of categories.

categories.description: List of categories in the current page

CategoryData.description: Represents an expense category for transaction classification.

address.description: Mailing address for sending a physical check.

CreateCoaTemplateRequest.description: Request body for creating a COA template

accounting_basis.description: The accounting basis for this Chart of Accounts template.

name.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for identifying the Chart of Accounts template.

CreateLedgerTemplateRequest.description: Request body for creating a ledger template

debit_credit.description: Indicates if the ledger is a credit or debit ledger.

editable.description: Whether line entries can be manually added or removed from the ledger.

financial_account_type.description: Indicates that the ledger represents a real-world financial account.

ledger_sub_type.description: Indicates similar characteristics and accounting treatment for a group of ledgers within a `type`.

ledger_type.description: Indicates the purpose and location of the funds and value recorded in the ledger and which report it is included in: `asset`, `liability` and `equity` ledgers are displayed on the balance sheet; `revenue` and `expenses` are displayed on the income statement.

parent_id.description: If the ledger is a child Ledger, the ID of the parent ledger object.

report_cash_flow.description: Whether Teal includes this ledger in the cash flow report.

sort_code.description: Determines the display order in reports, ordered digit by digit,

CreateWebhookParams.description: Request body for creating a new webhook endpoint

eventTypes.description: Optional array of event types to subscribe to. Nothing means subscribe to all event types.

filterPaths.description: Optional array of resource field paths to filter events by. When specified, webhook events will only be sent when one of these fields changes. Nothing means no filtering (all events are sent).

url.description: The URL to which webhook events will be delivered

exchangeRate.description:
Exchange rate goes from "from currency" to "to currency"
 (ie from currency * exchange rate = to currency)

CustomerId.description: The customer who will receive the invoice. Use the /api/v1/ar/customers endpoint to list your customers and find the corresponding id, or create a new customer first.

accountNumber.description: The account number of the bank account to use for domestic wire payments.

address.description: The address of the bank account to use for domestic wire payments. This has to be the recipient's legal address.

defaultForBenefitOf.description: The name of the beneficiary of the domestic wire. This is the name of the entity that will receive the domestic wire.

routingNumber.description: The routing number of the bank account to use for domestic wire payments.

checkInfo.description: Information needed to send a check.

contactEmail.description: Contact email address of the recipient

domesticWireRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send a domestic wire.

electronicRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send an ACH.

accountNumber.description: The account number of the bank account to use for ACH payments.

address.description: The address of the bank account to use for ACH payments. This has to be the recipient's legal address.

electronicAccountType.description: The type of bank account to use for ACH payments.

routingNumber.description: The routing number of the bank account to use for ACH payments.

defaultTemplates.description: Platform default COA templates available to this agent

nextPageToken.description: Token for fetching the next page of results

prevPageToken.description: Token for fetching the previous page of results

Request body for POST /api/v1/transfer endpoint.
 Transfers funds between two accounts belonging to the same organization.

Response for POST /api/v1/transfer endpoint.
 Returns both the credit and debit transactions for the transfer.

categoryCode.description: 4-digit merchant category code (MCC) for card transactions

MercuryCreditAccountStatementPeriodId.description: ID for the credit statement period

NonNegativeDollar.description: A positive dollar amount with at least 1 cent.

NoteUpdate.description: Note update action. Omit field to keep current note, send null or empty string to clear note, send text to set note.

dbaIsDefault.description: Whether this DBA is set as the default for payments

dbas.description: List of DBAs (Doing Business As names) for this organization

kind.description: Whether this is a personal or business organization

PositiveDollar.description: A positive dollar amount with at least 1 cent.

amount.description: Amount of USD you want to send, must be a positive number.

paymentMethod.description: Payment method to use, currently only supports "ach".

formType.description: The tax form type (W-9 for US persons, W-8BEN for foreign individuals, W-8BEN-E for foreign entities)

uploadedAt.description: Timestamp when the attachment was uploaded

url.description: Presigned URL to download the attachment (valid for 12 hours)

formType.description: The tax form type (W-9, W-8BEN, W-8BEN-E, or Unknown)

recipientId.description: The external ID of the recipient this attachment belongs to

url.description: Presigned URL to download the attachment (valid for 12 hours)

total.description: Total number of attachments in the current page

recipients.description: List of recipients in the current page

amount.description: Amount of USD you want to send, must be a positive number.

agent_id.description: The agent ID that owns this template

id.description: The unique ID of the COA template

items.description: The unique identifier for a Ledger

amount.description: The value of the line entry in decimal dollar cents.

tag_ids.description: A list of IDs of the Tag objects associated with the Line Entry.

items.description: The unique identifier for a Tag

datetime.description: The datetime the Journal Entry was created in UTC time.

description.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for displaying to the user.

line_entries.description:
The Line Entry objects to be associated with the Journal Entry. Must
 include at least two Line Entries, one debit and one credit, and the sum
 of the `amount`s of all debit entries must equal the sum of the
 `amount`s of the credit entries.

items.description: The unique identifier for a Journal Entry

creation_date.description: The timestamp when this journal entry record was created in the database.

creation_source.description: The source of the journal entry creation: 'manual' if created manually by the user, 'transaction' if auto-generated from transaction categorization (e.g., Plaid sync), or 'legacy' if auto-generated from the old AR/AP system.

datetime.description: The datetime the Journal Entry was created in UTC time

description.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for displaying to the user.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

is_opening_balance.description: Whether the Journal Entry represents an opening balance.

line_entries.description: List of Line Entries. Included in expanded responses.

line_entry_ids.description: The ids of the Line Entries detailing the Journal Entry's movement of value.

items.description: The unique identifier for a Line Entry

debit_credit.description: Whether this ledger is a debit or credit account

editable.description: Whether the ledger can be edited

report_cash_flow.description: Whether to report in cash flow

datetime.description: The datetime the Line Entry was created in UTC time.

debit_credit.description: Indicates if the amount is a credit or debit.

description.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for displaying to the user or for categorization.

editable.description: Indicates if the Line Entry can be manually added or removed from a Ledger, as dictated by the `editable` property on the Ledger.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

journal_entry_description.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for displaying to the user.

journal_entry_id.description: The ID of the associated Journal Entry.

ledger_id.description: The ID of the Line Entry's Ledger.

ledger_name.description: The name of the Line Entry's Ledger.

opposing_ledger_ids.description: Expandable. IDs of the ledgers on the other side(s) of the line entry with opposite debit/credit.

items.description: The unique identifier for a Ledger

related_line_entry_id.description:
If the Line Entry is identified as a transfer between accounts, the ID
 of the Line Entry in the opposing Ledger. Related guide:
 [Auto-categorization](https://docs.teal.dev/guides/platform/categorization/pipeline#transfers-between-accounts)

transaction_id.description: The ID of the associated Transaction, if one exists.

next_page_token.description: The token to use to request the next page

prev_page_token.description: The token to use to request the previous page

datetime.description: The datetime the Journal Entry was created in UTC time.

description.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for displaying to the user.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

line_entry_changes.description:
An object with optional `create`, `update`, and `delete` parameters to
 modify the Line Entries associated with the Journal Entry. The `create`
 and `update` parameters accept lists of Line Entry objects, while the
 `delete` parameter accepts a list of existing Line Entry IDs.

create.description: A list of new Line Entry objects to be created on the Journal Entry.

delete.description: A list of existing Line Entry IDs to delete.

items.description: The unique identifier for a Line Entry

update.description: A list of existing Line Entry objects to be updated on the Journal Entry.

amount.description: The value of the line entry in decimal dollar cents.

debit_credit.description: Indicates if the amount is a credit or debit.

description.description: An arbitrary string on the object, useful for displaying to the user or for categorization.

tag_ids.description: A list of IDs of the Tag objects associated with the Line Entry.

accountId.description: The external-facing account identifier for the Mercury account that owns this transaction

checkNumber.description: Present for check deposits and mailed checks; Nothing otherwise.

generalLedgerCodeName.description:
The name of the General Ledger (GL) code assigned to this transaction for accounting
 categorization. GL codes act as "bins" that organize transactions into accounting categories.
 This field is present when the transaction has been categorized, either manually by a user,
 via an accounting integration sync, or through auto-categorization rules. Nothing if the
 transaction has not been assigned a GL code.

merchant.description: Merchant information for card transactions; Nothing for non-card transactions

trackingNumber.description: Present for transactions that have tracking numbers (e.g., RTP, ACH, wires); Nothing otherwise.

TransactionPartyId.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

netReturns.description: Monthly net return breakdown with dividend and fee details

accounts.description: List of treasury accounts in the current page

page.description: Pagination information including cursors for navigating to next/previous pages

TreasuryDividend.description: Dividend information for a specific treasury security

securityName.description: Human-readable security name (e.g., "Morgan Stanley Ultra-Short Income Portfolio Class IR")

TreasuryNetReturn.description: Monthly net return breakdown for a treasury account

dividends.description: List of dividends received by security

month.description: First day of the month for this net return

status.description: Status of this net return calculation

treasuryFee.description: Treasury fee charged for this period (positive value)

UpdateWebhookParams.description:
Request body for updating an existing webhook endpoint.
 All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

eventTypes.description: Event types to subscribe to. Send null to subscribe to all event types. Send an array to subscribe to specific types. Omit to leave unchanged.

filterPaths.description: Resource field paths to filter events by. When specified, webhook events will only be sent when one of these fields changes. Send null for no filtering. Send an array to filter by specific fields. Omit to leave unchanged.

status.description: Webhook status. Only 'active' and 'paused' values are allowed. Omit to leave unchanged.

url.description: The URL to which webhook events will be delivered. Omit to leave unchanged.

UserDetails.description: Details of a user within an organization.

UsersPaginatedResponse.description: Paginated response containing a list of organization users.

page.description: Pagination information including cursors for navigating to next/previous pages

users.description: List of users in the current page

VerifyWebhookParams.description: Request body for verifying a webhook endpoint

eventType.description: Optional event type to test. If not specified, defaults to transaction.created.

basicAuth.description:
Basic authentication for Mercury API.

Use your API token as the username with an empty password.

Example:
Username: `secret-token:YOUR_MERCURY_API_TOKEN`
Password: (empty)

bearerAuth.description:
Bearer token authentication for Mercury API.

Use your API token in the Authorization header:
`Authorization: Bearer TOKEN`

Example:
`Authorization: Bearer secret-token:YOUR_MERCURY_API_TOKEN`

Your Mercury API token should include the 'secret-token:' prefix.
Tokens can be generated from your Mercury dashboard settings.

info.description: Streamline financial tasks with secure account management and transaction processing. Enables user registration, balance tracking, and payment handling.
info.title: Mercury API

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

get.description: Retrieve all debit and credit cards associated with a specific account.

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

post.description: Create a "request to send money" that will require approval based on your organization's approval policies.

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

get.description: Retrieve monthly statements for a specific account. Supports date range filtering.

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.
The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.
ID for this transaction

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of transactions for a specific account. Supports filtering by date range, status, and search terms.

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.
Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000
Earliest date to filter transactions. If not provided, defaults to 30 days before the current date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 string
Latest date to filter transactions. If not provided, defaults to the current date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or ISO 8601 string
Search term to filter transactions by description or counterparty name
Number of results to skip for pagination
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'desc'
ID returned from /account/:id/request-send-money
Name of mercuryCategory you want to filter on. Merchant Type in the UI.
UUID of a custom category. Can be returned from /categories endpoint.

400.description: Invalid `categoryId` or `mercuryCategory` or `requestId` or `order` or `offset` or `status` or `search` or `end` or `start` or `limit`

post.description: Send money from an account to a recipient. Creates a transaction that will be processed immediately or may require approval.

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of accounts. Supports cursor-based pagination with limit, order, start_after, and end_before query parameters.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

The ID of the account to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the account immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the account to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
The unique identifier for a Chart of Accounts Template

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of invoices. Supports cursor-based pagination with limit, order, start_after, and end_before query parameters.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

The ID of the invoice to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the invoice immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the invoice to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.

post.description: Create a new invoice for the organization

get.description: Retrieve details of an invoice by its ID

schema.description: ID for the invoice.
ID for the invoice.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all attachments for a specific invoice

schema.description: ID for the invoice.

post.description: Cancel an invoice. This action cannot be undone.

schema.description: ID for the invoice.

get.description: Downloads a PDF file for the specified invoice. The response includes a Content-Disposition header set to 'attachment' with the filename.

schema.description: ID for the invoice.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all available custom expense categories for the organization. Supports cursor-based pagination with limit, order, start_after, and end_before query parameters.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

The ID of the category to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the category immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the category to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all credit accounts for the organization.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000

The ID of the event to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the event immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the event to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

400.description: Invalid `resourceId` or `resourceType` or `order` or `end_before` or `start_after` or `limit`

schema.description: ID for the API event
Only return Journal Entries after the start date (inclusive).
Only return Journal Entries before the end date (inclusive).
Only return Journal Entries where at least one Line Entry belongs to the specified Ledger.
Only return Journal Entries with the specified creation source.
A comma separated list of sort orders for the results.
Comma-separated list of expandable paths.
Only return Journal Entries where the description matches the specified keyword(s).

Only return journal entries with the specified monetary amount.  If specified, `min_amount` and `max_amount` parameters are ignored.  If no decimal place provided, rounded values will be matched.  E.g. an input of `100` will match 100.13 and 100.45, but an input of `100.13` will only match that value.
Only return journal entries with a monetary amount of at least the specified amount.  Ignored if `amount` is set.
Only return journal entries with a monetary amount less than specified amount.  Ignored if `amount` is set.

One or more comma-separated lists of ledger IDs.  Only return Journal Entries where at least one Line Entry belongs to one of the specified ledgers in a group.  Specifying multiple groups will return an intersection of the matches.

items.description: The unique identifier for a Ledger

schema.description: The maximum number of journal entries to return per page.

400.description: Invalid `limit` or `ledger_id_groups` or `max_amount` or `min_amount` or `amount` or `keywords` or `page_token` or `expand` or `sort` or `creation_source` or `ledger_id` or `end_date` or `start_date` or `time_zone`

schema.description: Comma-separated list of expandable paths.
An optional identifier for audit logging.
The unique identifier for a Journal Entry
An optional field to include when retrieving a Journal Entry

get.description: Retrieve information about your organization including EIN, legal business name, and DBAs.
Retrieve details of a specific recipient by ID

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.
The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

post.summary: Edit information about a specific recipient

post.description: Upload a tax form attachment for a recipient. The file is uploaded via multipart/form-data. Supported file types include PDF, images (PNG, JPG, GIF), and common document formats. The attachment will be associated as a tax document for the recipient.

parameters.description: ID of the recipient to attach the file to
parameters.name: recipientId

file.description: The file to upload (tax form document)

requestBody.description: File to upload. Use form field name 'file'.

200.description: Successfully uploaded attachment. Returns attachmentId and downloadUrl.

400.description: Bad request. Either no file was uploaded or the filename exceeds the 299 character limit.

413.description: File too large. Maximum file size is 32MB.

415.description: Unsupported file type. Potentially dangerous file extensions (e.g., .exe, .bat) are not allowed.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all recipients. Use cursor parameters (start_after, end_before) for pagination.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000

The ID of the recipient to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the recipient immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the recipient to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

post.description: Create a new recipient for making payments

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all recipient tax form attachments across all recipients in the organization. Use cursor parameters (start_after, end_before) for pagination.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000

The ID of the recipient attachment to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the recipient attachment immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the recipient attachment to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'
ID for the send money approval request

get.summary: Get send money approval request by ID

get.description: Retrieve all SAFE (Simple Agreement for Future Equity) requests for your organization.
Retrieve a specific SAFE request by its ID.

schema.description: ID for the SAFE request

get.description: Download the PDF document for a specific SAFE request. Returns binary PDF data with a Content-Disposition header.

schema.description: ID for the SAFE request

get.description: Downloads a PDF file for the specified account statement. The response includes a Content-Disposition header for proper file download handling. Returns binary PDF data.

schema.description: ID for the account statement

get.description: Retrieve a single transaction by its ID. Returns full transaction details including attachments, check images, and related metadata.

schema.description: ID for this transaction

patch.description: Update the note and/or category of an existing transaction. Use null values to clear existing data.

schema.description: ID for this transaction

post.description: Upload a file attachment to a transaction. The file is uploaded via multipart/form-data. Supported file types include PDF, images (PNG, JPG, GIF), and common document formats.

parameters.description: ID of the transaction to attach the file to
parameters.name: transactionId

attachmentType.description: Type of attachment: 'receipt', 'bill', or 'other'. Defaults to 'other'.

requestBody.description: File to upload. Use form field name 'file'. Optionally include 'attachmentType' field with value 'receipt', 'bill', or 'other'.

200.description: Successfully uploaded attachment. Returns attachmentId and downloadUrl.

400.description: Bad request. Either no file was uploaded or the filename exceeds the 299 character limit.

413.description: File too large. Maximum file size is 32MB.

415.description: Unsupported file type. Potentially dangerous file extensions (e.g., .exe, .bat) are not allowed.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all transactions across all accounts. Supports advanced filtering by date ranges, status, categories, and cursor-based pagination.

schema.description: Search term to look for in transaction descriptions.

Earliest createdAt date to filter for. If not provided, it defaults to the date of your first transaction. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or an ISO 8601 string. Please note that your Mercury transactions on your Dashboard might have their postedAt date displayed, as opposed to createdAt

Latest createdAt date to filter for. If it's not provided, it defaults to current day. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or an ISO 8601 string. Please note that your Mercury transactions on your Dashboard might have their postedAt date displayed, as opposed to createdAt
Earliest postedAt date to filter for. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or an ISO 8601 string
Latest postedAt date to filter for. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or an ISO 8601 string

items.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.

schema.description: Name of mercuryCategory you want to filter on. Merchant Type in the UI.
UUID of a custom category. Can be returned from /categories endpoint.

The ID of the resource to start the page at (inclusive). When provided, results will begin with and include the resource with this ID. Use this to retrieve a specific page when you know the exact starting point. Cannot be combined with start_after or end_before.

The ID of the transaction to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the transaction immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the transaction to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

400.description: Invalid `order` or `limit` or `end_before` or `start_after` or `start_at` or `categoryId` or `mercuryCategory` or `accountId` or `postedEnd` or `postedStart` or `end` or `start` or `search` or `status`

post.description: Transfer funds between two accounts within the same organization. Creates paired debit and credit transactions.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all treasury accounts associated with the authenticated organization. Use cursor parameters (start_after, end_before) for pagination.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000

The ID of the account to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the account immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the account to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

get.description: Retrieve paginated treasury transactions for a specific treasury account.

schema.description: The Mercury account where invoice payments will be deposited. Use the /api/v1/accounts endpoint to list your accounts and find the corresponding id. Only checking and savings accounts are supported.
Maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 100
Sort order for transactions. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'desc'
Pagination cursor for retrieving next batch of transactions. Must be an integer >= 0
Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000

The ID of the user to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the user immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the user to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'
ID for the user

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all webhook endpoints for your organization. Supports filtering by status.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return. Allowed range: 1 to 1000. Defaults to 1000

The ID of the webhook to start the page after (exclusive). When provided, results will begin with the webhook immediately following this ID. Use this for standard forward pagination to get the next page of results. Cannot be combined with end_before.

The ID of the webhook to end the page before (exclusive). When provided, results will end just before this ID and work backwards. Use this for reverse pagination or to retrieve previous pages. Cannot be combined with start_after.
Sort order. Can be 'asc' or 'desc'. Defaults to 'asc'

schema.description: ID for the webhook

post.description: Update the configuration of an existing webhook endpoint

schema.description: ID for the webhook

post.description: Send a test event to verify the webhook endpoint is properly configured and reachable. The request body accepts an optional 'eventType' field to specify which event type to test (e.g., 'transaction.created', 'transaction.updated'). If omitted from the request body, defaults to 'transaction.created'.

schema.description: ID for the webhook
